candidates.title: Generate embed code instead of using interpolation
candidates.body:
Because the output path of the embedded files changes per machine, the interpolate-folder-path feature of rust-embed was used to set the correct embed path. This feature however creates a rather large dependency tree (shell_expand -> dirs -> dirs-sys -> option-ext)

By generating a small file with the correct folder already filled in, then including it in lib.rs we can remove this feature and reduce the amount of dependencies that are used.

Implementation was inspired by how the "built" crate recommends people to use it.

candidates.title: Update Rocket v0.5
candidates.body:
Hi! This is my first time to contribute to this repo, so I may have missed something.

Rocket 0.5 has been released 🎉 This pull request updates Rocket's version from `0.5.0-rc3` to `0.5`.

Thanks!

candidates.title: Support serde `deny_unknown_fields`
candidates.body: Closes https://github.com/juhaku/utoipa/issues/812

candidates.title: Axum 0.7 bindings
candidates.body:
Hi! First contribution to this repo, so may have missed some things.

Axum 0.7 just got released which has some breaking changes to bring everything up to date with hyper 1.0.

The main consequence for utoipa is the removal of hyper's `HttpBody` from `Router`.

Resolves #808

candidates.title: Add `decimal_float` feature.
candidates.body:
This feature aim to provide utoipa user's the ability to change the default type for Decimal to Number without the need of overriding the type everywhere much like rust_decimal expose a serde-with-float feature. 
This feature is mutually exclusive with `decimal` feature.

candidates.title: Feat url type
candidates.body:
This PR adds support for [url](https://github.com/servo/rust-url).

`Url` type will be presented as `String` with  format `uri` in OpenAPI spec.

candidates.title: Support ULID
candidates.body: This PR adds support for [ulid](https://github.com/dylanhart/ulid-rs).

candidates.title: Add rapidoc support
candidates.body:
Add rapidoc support for utoipa and update todo examples. Add new warp-rapidoc example to demonstrate rapidoc without predefined framework integration.

Add utoipa-rapidoc CI setup.

Resolves #554

candidates.title: Add redoc support for utoipa.
candidates.body:
Add redoc support for utoipa.
    
Create new utoipa-redoc create and add simple redoc implementation. Add
redoc service support for actix-web, axum and rocket.
    
Add new warp-todo-redoc example to demonstarte utoipa-redoc in
standalone without pre-existing web framework integration.
    
Add CI setup for utoipa-redoc.

#531

candidates.title: Fix generics actix example
candidates.body: Fix missing feature flag on `geo-types` for generics-actix example. Remove unused import generating warning.

candidates.title: Fix `Arc<T>` and `Rc<T>` and `SmallVec<[T]>`
candidates.body:
This commit adds `rc_schema` feature flag that enables `ToSchema` support for `Arc<T>` and `Rc<T>` types. This does not itself enable serde `rc` feature flag but it must be enabled separately.

Also this fixes `smallvec` support where it previously created double nested array in generated schema.

#698 #691

candidates.title: Add tests for uuid path params
candidates.body:
Add tests for testing uuid and new type type pattern with uuid used as path parameter of http handler.

Resolves #675

candidates.title: Add automatic body recognition for rocket
Add automatic type recognition for axum
candidates.body:
Add automatic request body recognition and improve existing path params recognition for axum.

Resolves #591

candidates.title: Add automatic query parameter recognition
candidates.body:
Add automatic query parameter recognition. And improve existing code related to path and query parameters recognition and elsewhere.

Resolves #591

candidates.title: Rename `auto_types` feature flag
candidates.body:
Rename `auto_types` feature flag to `auto_into_responses` since it actually is only used for automatic IntoResponses definition. This feature is higly experiemental and should be used with cauntion. It is more likely that the final implementation will look different thus changes are to be expected.

Simultaneusly allow automatic resolvation for request bodies without extra feature flag. Supported only with `actix_extras` feature by now.

candidates.title: Add support for chrono::NaiveTime
candidates.body: Since the OpenAPI spec does not explicitly support times without attached dates, I have implemented this in the same way that support for `duration` was done, but formatting them as strings.

candidates.title: add preserve_path_order feature
candidates.body:
As discussed in [602](https://github.com/juhaku/utoipa/issues/602) this PR introduces a cargo feature named preserve_path_order to retain path order when serializing OpenAPI paths.

Closes #602

candidates.title: Add generics example
candidates.body: I expect this may be able to be improved, in which case I will learn a bit along the way.

candidates.title: Add basic auto response type support
candidates.body:
This PR adds new `auto_types` feature flag that enables automatic
response type resolvation from functions decorated with `#[utoipa::path]`
attribute macro. 

When enabled the return value of such function must implement `IntoResponses`
trait. By default it is implemented for `Result<T, E>` and for unit type
`()`.

Return value is then used as responses provider for the handler function
saving the need of manual declaration of responses within
`#[utoipa::path]` macro.

Closes #591

candidates.title: Allow additional integer types
candidates.body:
Make use of formats added in https://github.com/juhaku/utoipa/pull/571

These are not recognised according to https://swagger.io/specification/#data-types , but are very common.

Maybe we need a feature flag to enable this?

candidates.title: Allow value_type serde_json::Value
candidates.body: c.f. https://github.com/juhaku/utoipa/discussions/567

candidates.title: Refactor alises support on `ToSchema` derive
candidates.body:
Prior to this commit the implementation was not able to resolve nested generics within aliases. That lead scenarios where types with extensive use of lifetimes was not possible.

This commit takes another approach on aliases support for `ToSchema` derive macro that provides generic schema types. Instead of trying to parse `Generics` manually we parse `syn::Type` instead that contains generics as is allowing complex generic arguments with lifetimes to be used.

Fundamental difference is that we create `TypeTree` for alias and the implementor type. Then we compare generic arguments to the field arguments and replace matching occurrences.
```rust
 #[derive(ToSchema)]
 #[aliases(Paginated1 = Paginated<'b, String>, Paginated2 = Paginated<'b, Cow<'b, bool>>)]
 struct Paginated<'r, T> {
     pub total: usize,
     pub data: Vec<T>,
     pub next: Option<&'r str>,
     pub prev: Option<&'r str>,
 }
```

~One caveat with this approach is that the lifetimes now need to be also defined on the left side of the equals (=) mark.~

Removed  the need to define lifetimes on left side of the equals (=) sign.

Fixes #427, Fixes #524

candidates.title: Upgrade to syn2
candidates.body: Make necessary changes to the `utoipa-gen` in order to work with syn2.

candidates.title: Add full support for nullable field detection
candidates.body:
This PR replaces the old old behavior with `Option` fields. The existing implementation is naive in it's logic which is prone to result incorrect OpenAPI clients if one is not careful with nullable fields.

 ### The old implementation

Named struct field is considered required if
* it is not `Option` type
* or it has not serde `default` attribute.

Nullable had to be defined manually for the field.

 ### New implementation

Named struct field is considered required if
  * it does not have `skip_serializing_if` property
  * and it does not have `serde_with` douple_option
  * and it does not have default value provided with serde `default` attribute

Also nullable is now being automatically detected from `Option` fields.

Additionally this commit add support for recognizing `double_option` from https://github.com/jonasbb/serde_with.

Most importantly `Option` fields will be considered **required** by default after this change. This is because by default `serde` serializes `Option` as `null` and secondly to keep the generated classes consistent with the API doc.

Fixes #314
